alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Franklin; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 27 at 1:59PM EST until February 27 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST FOR SOUTHERN FRANKLIN...NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY AND NORTH CENTRAL DEARBORN COUNTIES... At 159 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oldenburg, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Sunman, St. Leon, Cedar Grove, New Trenton, Penntown, Lawrenceville, Saint Peter and Interstate 74 at State Route 101. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 150 and 166. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for southeastern Indiana. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
